content: I’m currently a Machine Learning Engineer, 3D at Stability AI, doing R&D work involving generative 3D models such as SF3D. Before that, I worked as a Research Engineer at AMD Japan, doing R&D work involving path tracing with neural rendering and contributed towards new HW features for these workloads. I completed my master’s from the University of Tokyo, supervised by Prof. Toshiya Hachisuka and Prof. Nobuyuki Umetani. My research interests include light transport simulation, real-time rendering, neural rendering and machine learning.

title: Aaryaman Vasishta

summary: Stable Virtual Camera (SEVA) is a generalist diffusion model for Novel View Synthesis (NVS). Given any number of input views and their cameras, it generates novel views of a scene at any target camera of interest
title: Stable Virtual Camera: Generative View Synthesis with Diffusion Models

summary: SPAR3D is a fast single-image 3D reconstructor with intermediate point cloud generation, which allows for interactive user edits and achieves state-of-the-art performance.
title: SPAR3D: Stable Point-Aware Reconstruction of 3D Objects from Single Images

summary: We present HIPRT, an open-source ray tracing framework in HIP. HIPRT provides a versatile, cross-platform solution for professional rendering on contemporary many-core architectures.
title: HIPRT: A Ray Tracing Framework in HIP

summary: We present Stable Fast 3D (SF3D) - a feed-forward 3D asset generation model , which generates UV-unwrapped, textured models with material parameters and delit albedo in under a second.
title: SF3D: Stable Fast 3D Mesh Reconstruction with UV-unwrapping and Illumination Disentanglement
